metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3169 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A denial of service flaw may occur ifthere is a consecutive request of the NVME_IOCTL_RESET and theNVME_IOCTL_SUBSYS_RESET through the device file of the driver, resulting ina PCIe link disconnect.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1097-aws - 5.4.0-1097.105~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-azure - 5.4.0-1104.110~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1101-gcp - 5.4.0-1101.110~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1045-ibm - 5.4.0-1045.50~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1094-oracle - 5.4.0-1094.103~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1081-raspi - 5.4.0-1081.92~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.

linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1097.105~18.04.1').
